channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024020546
item.description:
Report X-2024020546

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020546 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED GUIDLINES IN DECSION TREE AND BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. 2. X-2024020547 SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTT WITH THE DESCIOSN TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE LEAK. RESPONDER CLEANED THE LEAKER ACCORDING TO THE DECSION TREE. LEAKER WAS BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024020545
item.description:
Report X-2024020545

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE DECISION TREE WAS USED; GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON AND GLOVES WERE DONNED. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS WERE TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA. ALL CONTAMINATED MATERIALS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2024020296
item.description:
Report E-2024020296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a release UN3266 Mainline Liquid 102 from a 250-gallon poly tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of material released to a 12’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot underneath the trailer due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Citric acid solution and absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024020724
item.description:
Report X-2024020724

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-28
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was pulled off induction and placed on the ground. Several hours later when the inductor went to take the Hazmat down from induction he saw that it was leaking. DescribePack: There is a crack on the side of the bottle. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a tub and the spilled liquid was cleaned using PPE.

item.title: Report X-2024020426
item.description:
Report X-2024020426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020426 SequenceEvent: Package was placed on it's side allowing liquid to be forced through the caps. Package was discovered in the unload and QA was called to isolate and remove the package. DescribePack: contents leaked through the caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined tote and placed in the HAZMAT cage for evaluation. 2. X-2024020427 SequenceEvent: Package appears to have been dropped, forcing liquid through the caps. Package was discovered in the unload and QA was called. DescribePack: Contents leaked through the lid of one bottle and damaged the other three. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined tote and placed in the HAZMAT cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020252
item.description:
Report X-2024020252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the load leaking, It was placed in a spill tote and sent to QA for inspection. DescribePack: There wasn't enough pack material to keep the contents from moving around and the top was not protected to keep the dispense valve from being pressed and releasing the contents of the bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was found leaking and was placed in a spill tote and sent to QA for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024020074
item.description:
Report X-2024020074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A PACKAGE WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS LEAKING IN AN UNLOAD TRAILER. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE PACKAGE AND ALL RELATED MATERIAL IN LINED SPILL TUBS AND TRANSPORTED THEM TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024020057
item.description:
Report X-2024020057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020057 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECSION TREE GUIDLINES AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK LEAKER WITH AFFECTED BOXES TO THE DMP. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF. 2. X-2024020058 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES IN THE DECSION TREE WHILE CLEANING UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. 3. X-2024020059 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING DECSION TREE GUIDELINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OFF.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS TRANSFERRED TO DMN DUE TO LEAKING FROM INSIDE, CREATING WET CARDBOARD. PACKAGE HAS LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON THE LABEL. TWO OTHER OBJECTS IN THE PACKAGE WERE WET FROM THE CONTENTS, A PILATES BLANKET AND A REVOLN VOLUMIZING BRUSH. AEROSOL CANISTER HAD THE CAP BROKEN AND RELEASED THE CONTENTS.
